[ C ] the solid outer layer of a planet: The interior of the Moon cooled and the lithosphere became rather thick. the lithosphere
[ S ] the solid outer layer of the earth: The lithosphere is about 100 kilometres thick and is rigid and strong. Parts of the lithosphere could be moved apart by the sideways movement of the currents underneath. See also
